artist: Designer: Larsen Design Studio, New York; Producer: Jack Lenor Larsen, Inc.; Designer: Paul Gedeohn
image_copyright: © Jack Lenor Larsen, Inc., Paul Gedeohn, Larsen Design Studio
text:
During the 1980s Paul Gedeohn developed a number of fabrics with complex
patterns, wherein printed graphics were layered within woven imagery to
create an integrated whole.  Working in Switzerland with both a print and a
weaving mill, which were in close proximity and willing to collaborate on Larsen projects, allowed for a level of experimentation that was not usually possible.  

In the two color-ways we see here (Water Opal and Roselake), the threads
were first printed with a leaf pattern and then put on a loom that was
programmed to weave a variation of the same graphic in a damask structure.
The intersection of the woven and printed patterns creates additional design
elements.  This particular patterning system also creates a reversible fabric.
title: Lucerne
